fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more than 100 blog posts
# Click "show more blog posts" at the sidebar

h3. Expected Results
You will be able to see all the previous posts

h3. Actual Results
You can't find the previous posts from the same year.
You will only be able to see the previous posts for other years.

h3.Workaround
Use the search function of your site or Blog Post macro.
fields.summary: Unable to find old blog posts in the sidebar when there are 100+ posts in the same year

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to restrict the Blog Posts macro by spaces, it will erase all previous entered space keys when selecting another space.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a Blog Posts macro;
# In the *Restrict to these Spaces* field, start typing a space name and select the space;
# Insert a comma and repeat the previous step to select another space.

h3. Expected Results
Both space keys should be listed.

h3. Actual Results
Any previous space keys are deleted, as shown below:
 !blog_macro.gif|width=500! 

h3.Workaround
Manually insert each space key separated by comma.
fields.summary: Blog Posts macro allows to select only a single space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Restricted Space Homepage throws error

Error: GraphQL error: Unknown error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence Space's homepage go to *Restrictions*
 # Add another user - other than yourself - to the page's restrictions
 # Go to *Space Settings* > *Permissions* > *Restrictions*
 # Remove yourself from the restrictions in that page
 # Go to the homepage

h3. Expected Results

The page would display a "non-permitted access" / "request access" message/button.
h3. Actual Results

The page throws a *Something's gone Wrong* message with a stack trace below.
{code:java}
Something's gone wrong.
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.

Error details:
Error: GraphQL error: Unknown error.
{code}
 
{panel:title=Screenshot}
!Screen Shot 2018-10-01 at 14.13.46.png|width=512,height=501!
{panel}
 
h3. Workaround
 # Go to *Space Settings* > *Permissions* > *Restrictions*
 # Drop all restrictions (by clicking into each padlock associated to that page, individually)

OR
 # Ask a user with enough rights to add you to that page's restrictions.
fields.summary: GraphQL Error Thrown when Space Homepage is Restricted

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Confluence Cloud app or mobile browser, access a page which has a macro(ex. Google Drive) embedded

h3. Expected Results
User is able to see the contents of the embedded data

h3. Actual Results
The following message is shown.
{code}
Tap to see <macro> content in your browser
{code}

h3. Notes
If the user was using the app, they will have to tap the message to open the mobile browser and then switch to desktop view, which is a little effort.
fields.summary: See the contents of embedded macro in mobile/app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Export to PDF page process generation is taking longer with Jira issues attached

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to one Confluence page
# Export this page to pdf
# Notice that the export is taking 9 seconds
# Add to that page some Jira issues and save it
# Export the page again to pdf
# Notice that a new export is taking longer (4 min 21 seconds/6 min 41 seconds)

h3. Expected Results
The page pdf export process should be completed in a reasonable time.

h3. Actual Results
The page pdf export process when the page has Jira issues attached is taking longer.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: PDF generation taking longer with Jira issues attached

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating Meeting Notes pages from the template no longer create the index page since rollout of the new editor.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the 'plus' button to create a new page and select the *Meeting Notes* template.

h3. Expected Results
An index page is also created.

h3. Actual Results
No index page is created.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment. If the index page is created manually, it also won't display the pages.
fields.summary: New Meeting Notes Template does not create the index anymore.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* You will see the old view when you create a new Meeting notes using a modified Meeting notes template.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Space Settings > Content Tools > Templates > Meeting notes Blueprint
# Edit the Meeting notes template
# Save the changes
# Create a new page using '+' on the sidebar
# Choose Meeting notes template

h3. Expected Results
* Simpler editing experience should also works in creating meeting notes from modified meeting notes template.

h3. Actual Results
* Simpler editing experience doesn't work in creating meeting notes from modified meeting notes template.
fields.summary: Simpler editing experience is not working if the Meeting notes template was modified

fields.description:
h3. Summary
HTML Exports fails in Spaces with more than 3 GB in Attachments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence space, attach files to pages until you have at least 3 GB of attachments in the space
# Go to *Content Tools* > *Export* > *HTML*

h3. Expected Results
The Space will be exported.

h3. Actual Results
Export stalls at 0% 

h3. Note
Issue has been identified on tenant with smaller size of attachments on a space
fields.summary: HTML Exports fails in Spaces with more than 3 GB in Attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pages exports to PDF are failing with the error below, at 0%:
{code}There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.{code}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page
# Click on •••
# Export to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The page should be exported

h3. Actual Results
The export fails immediately, with 0% and the error
{code}There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.{code}
as shown below: 
!pdf_export.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
# Access the page with Chrome
# Click on ••• and select "View source"
# Export to PDF using the browser shortcut (Ctrl+P or command+P)
fields.summary: Page exports to PDF are failing at 0%

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
There are a couple of macros missing from the Editor in Confluence Cloud.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Open Page, Edit it
# Search for one of the affected macros
# Try finding it

h3. Affected Macros
- Version Report Macro
fields.summary: Macros missing from 'Other Macros'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, not all administration pages on Confluence's settings have its related documentation linked.

This can cause difficulties to the customers, as they'll have to look up for the related documentation, not always finding it and having to open a ticket with the support for assistance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
A simple solution would be to create an entry in the Help menu and link to the documentation related to the current page, as illustrated in the GIF below:
 !help_on_this_page.gif|width=900!
fields.summary: Link related documentation to Confluence Admin pages

fields.description:
We are developing Confluence-Slack integration and we want to implement `/confluence tasks` command that would return tasks for user from this page [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action] - but there is no API in Confluence for this yet.

We had to use cql text search with user name to find all tasks that are assigned to user and then parse `storage` format to extract all tasks. This is not the best approach - moreover this way we can not find tasks that were created by user.

cc: [~vsaienko] [~idaynatovich] [~dostapenko@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Expose an API to get tasks assigned to user/created by user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Space or Site import from Confluence Server to Confluence Cloud fails and the following error is shown:
{code:java}
Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: org.owasp.validator.html.ScanException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1024
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Import space or site from Confluence Server to Confluence Cloud with text that has JSON or JSON like content.
h3. Expected Results

Import is successful
h3. Actual Results

Import fails with the error:
{code:java}
Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: org.owasp.validator.html.ScanException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1024
{code}
h3. Notes

This issue may happen in case you have a page in confluence Server that contains JSON or JSON like code inside of a macro.
h3. Workaround

You need to exclude problematic page from Space and import it separately using export/import to Word.
 Please [contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] to help you find problematic page.
fields.summary: Space or site import fails with error "ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException" when migrating from Server to Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when the user uses a Template that creates an index page that will include all the sub-pages/pages using this template in the space. At the moment, the index page is not retrieving any results for the created pages with the templates:

!empty.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the 'plus' button to create a new page and select the *Project Plan/Meeting Notes* template (or any other that should have an index page).
# After creating a page with this template, go to the index page that will be the parent of the one that you created

h3. Expected Results
The created pages with the template should be displayed there.

h3. Actual Results
No pages are displayed as the screenshot above. 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
If the index page is created manually, it also won't display the pages.
fields.summary: Template's Index Not Retrieving pages

fields.description:
In Confluence, when you work with drafts/unpublished changes to a page, if you upload an attachment, the same will be already available for the current version of the page. The users just need to access the Page Tools (ellipsis button) to see the attachment and/or try to visualize the current images of the page using the *preview*.

For some cases, the users expect the attachment to not be available prior to publish it due to security reasons. This is a suggestion to allow Confluence to hide the attachments prior to publishing a page.
fields.summary: Option to Not Upload Attachments Before Publishing Page

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1) Add a dynamic content macro with rich text
fields.summary: Connect rich text macros don't allow static content macro's within them

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Intermittently, at random intervals (no pattern indentified so far), Confluence sends multiple notifications for the same event (e.g. a page update, a like, a comment, etc).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Watch a page
# A different user updates the watched page

h3. Expected Results
You get one email notification for the event

h3. Actual Results
The same notification is received multiple times
 
h3. Notes
- This seems to be a re-occurrence of CONFCLOUD-58452. 
- It  looks like the notification jobs are erroring out and aree re-queued, despite actually sending the email - this is what leads to multiple emails being sent
- Lots of errors in logs are found related to the notification batch job (rendering timeout, tenant context) - although it is unclear whether this is leading to the notifications being re-queued
fields.summary: Multiple (duplicate/delayed) notifications being intermittently sent for the same event

fields.description:
h1. Investigating
We are investigating increased error rates for some Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers. We will provide more details shortly.

h1. Identified
We have identified the root cause of increased error rates for some Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers. We are working with our external service provider to resolve the issues. We will provide another update shortly.

*Update: 26th September 08:25 UTC* 
We continue to work with our service provider, AWS, to resolve the root cause of increased error rates for some Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers. We will provide another update shortly. 

h1. Resolved

Between 07:10 UTC to 08:56 UTC, Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers experienced connectivity issues to their instance. The root cause was identified as a networking issue with our service provider. The issue has been resolved and the services are now operating normally.

h3. Please watch this ticket to receive further updates.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud Outage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence shows a different behavior when adding bullet points using _Shift + *_ shortcut.

h3. Description
When deleting @mention names next to a bullet point, the bullet point gets deleted after removing the last character of the @mention. This *only* happens when the bullet point was added using _Shift + *_ shortcut. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit a page
# Press _Shift + *_  to add a bullet point
# Enter a _@mention_ name
# Hit _backspace_ until the last character of the user's name is deleted 

h3. Expected Results
The bullet point shouldn't be deleted. 

h3. Current Results
The bullet point is deleted after deleting the last character of the @mention name.

h3. Workaround
Add bullet points manually through the editing panel.
fields.summary: Bullet point is automatically deleted after deleting the last character of the @mention name next to it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, user email is visible for all users even though the User Email visibility is set to be visible for site-administrators only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to Security Configuration in Confluence.
# Set User Email Visibility to only visible to site administrators.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-25 at 16.16.39.png|thumbnail! 
# Log in as a normal Confluence user (who is not a site admin).
# Hover over another user's name.

h3. Expected Results
User's email should not be visible when hovering over the user name.


h3. Actual Results
User's email should is visible when hovering over the user name.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-25 at 2.07.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This seems to be a regression of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-54669

h3. Workaround
No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Email is visible when hover over another user's name, although Email visibility is set only to site admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, restricted Team Calendars are not being returned in the search results.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a calendar or get the name of an existing one;
 # Add restrictions to the calendar (make sure user has permission to see the calendar)
 # Search for this exact calendar name using the advanced search functionality (click 'advance search' in the quick search drawer) 
 # Update the search filter on the left hand side 'of type' to be 'custom' and select calendars

h3. Expected Results

Results should include this calendar
h3. Actual Results

No calendars with restrictions are returned.

 
h3. Workaround

Directly access the calendar.

OR

Use the calendar search functionality in the team calendars view
 # Starting from: my calendar (global nav -> add-ons -> calendars) or space calendar (click on calendars link in the space sidebar) or page (add calendar macro)
 # Chose to 'add existing calendar'
 # Search for other calendars
fields.summary: Confluence search not returning restricted calendars as results
getContent Refactor Change - Freeze Prod Deployment
Confluence Parser is Very Opinionated About HTML Block Elements

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the user clicks keyboard shortcut *E* while editing a macro, somehow the page will be highlighted and changes made on the macro will be added on the page instead.


h3. Step to replicate

# Add roadmap macro planer
# Add new lane and try to change lane name (Should not be able to change it)
# Click E
# Add any text


h3. Observed behavior

The text will be added on the page instead.

h3. Expected behavior

The Text should not be added on the page.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut "E" take precedence when editing Roadmap Planne macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User unable to change lane name on the first try in Roadmap planner after adding it. 


h3. How to replicate
# Create a page and add Roadmap planner
# Click edit and add lane
# After adding it, edit the lane name

h3. Observed Behavior

Unable to edit the name

h3. Expected Behavior

User able to edit the name on the first try


h3. Workaround

On 2nd try, the user should be able to edit the name.
fields.summary: Not able to edit new lane name in Roadmap planner

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When the *Excerpt* macro is added to a blog page and its set to hidden, the content of the macro is still displayed. This affects only bogs and not pages

h2. How to reproduce
# Click create a blog
# Add the *Excerpt macro" to the blog
# Check the option *Hide Excerpted Content*
# Click insert
# Add content into the Excerpt macro
# Click publish

h3. Expected behavior
The content of the excerpt macro should be hidden

h3. Actual results
The content of the macro is still displayed.

h2. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Excerpt macro cannot be set to hidden in Blog
Context parameters sent by the New Confluence editor is incorrect and results to 404

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new editor (blog page) is not possible to insert more than one live macro in a page.

The Balsamiq add-on uses a custom editor. No live macro is inserted when the submit button (i.e. dialog.getButton("submit")) is clicked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two macros (tested using Balsamiq Wireframes)
Steps to reproduce video: http://recordit.co/5zwQAfbAmj

h3. Expected Results
A new macro is inserted in the page

h3. Actual Results
The second macro is not inserted in the page
fields.summary: Cannot create more than one 3rd party macro in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When embedding a pdf file in blogpost, the thumbnail doesn't show as an image

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a blogpost.
# Embed a pdf thumbnails on the blog and publish it
# Noticed that the thumbnails doesn't show as a image
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. *Expected Results*

The pdf thumbnails should be able to show image

h3. *Actual Results*

PDF thumbnails doesn't show image when embeded on the blog post.



h3. *Workaround*
 None
fields.summary: PDF documents attached to the blog doesn't show image

fields.description: When creating a new personal space, the URL for the Overview of the space is being displayed as {0}’s Home.
fields.summary: [BE] Personal Space's links displaying as '{0}' instead of string

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding attachments macro inside a dynamic macro with a rich-text bodyType, the following error occurs:

# When expanding the attachment, getting error:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-21 at 10.29.36 AM.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
Failed to load https://new-test-anne.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/plugins/attachments/loadattachmentversions.action?attachmentId=11796481&_=1537496948995: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. Origin 'https://macro-toolbox-for-cloud.addonengine.com' is therefore not allowed access.
batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:370 Error retrieving attachment old versions: 
frontend-service-worker-cache.js:152 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to execute 'fetch' on 'ServiceWorkerGlobalScope': 'only-if-cached' can be set only with 'same-origin' mode
    at frontend-service-worker-cache.js:152
{code}

# When uploading a file:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-21 at 10.41.40 AM.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
confluence.extra.attachments:attachments-javascript.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:5 Uncaught DOMException: Blocked a frame with origin "https://macro-toolbox-for-cloud.addonengine.com" from accessing a cross-origin frame.
    at HTMLIFrameElement.<anonymous> (https://d245y5s2hyv7y6.cloudfront.net/new-test-anne.atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/1277938697/h/0634e39ce454c96c4932ec5414945098/_/download/batch/confluence.extra.attachments:attachments-javascript/confluence.extra.attachments:attachments-javascript.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:5:6546)
    at HTMLIFrameElement.dispatch (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1:32135)
    at HTMLIFrameElement.a (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1:27826)
{code}

*Steps to replicate*
1. Attach an attachment to a page or blog
2. Edit that page or blog and insert a Dynamic Content Macro (an example is the Tabs macro as a part of Macro Toolbox) with a rich-text bodyType onto a page (new editor or old)
3. Add the attachments macro inside of that Dynamic Content Macro and publish the page
4. The macros should load initially as expected
fields.summary: Attachments macro does not work inside a dynamic macro with a rich-text bodyType

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Cloud customers are unable to access the Page Information option from the Page Menu 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a Page and Click on the Menu button "..."

h3. Expected Results
Page Information is provided as an option

h3. Actual Results
There's no Page Information:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Customers can still access the Page Information page by using it's URL:
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewinfo.action?pageId=<ID>
fields.summary: Unable to Access Page Information from Menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Livesearch Macro is not suggesting results when anonymous access is enabled on a space that has been created as Jira Service Desk Knowledge Base. In the browser Developer Tools is possible to see that an error 401 is returned when calling the search endpoint (rest/searchv3/1.0/search).

!Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 18.25.14.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have one instance with Confluence and Jira Service Desk
 # Create a Confluence space
 # Enable *Anonymous access* in Space permissions and Global permissions
 # Open an incognito window (or a private browsing window, depending on which browser you use) and access the space without logging-in. Run a search and see that everythig works as expected
 # Now link the space to a Jira Service Desk project as explained in the [Set Up a Knowledge Base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/set-up-a-knowledge-base-957150219.html] documentation page
 # Modify the search permissions for Jira Service Desk to *enable view access for all users*
 # Check the Space overview and search in Livesearch, notice that there are results suggested
 # Repeat step 4 (logout, use private/incognito window, or use a different browser to access the space and run a search)

h3. Expected Results

Livesearch should suggest results for anonymous users as it happened in step #4
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 18.27.38.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

No suggested results are shown. In the browser developer tools it is seen that Livesearch is returning a 401 error.

This is because after linking the space to a JSD project the username *anonymous* is added to the arguments passed to the REST API search endpoint and since there is no user having such username in the instance error 401 is returned:


 *When the space is not linked to a JSD project the GET request is:*
{code:java}
https://troubleshootingcompany.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/searchv3/1.0/search?queryString=test&where=TS1&type=page&user=&pageSize=5&highlight=false&sessionUuid=0-0-0-0
{code}
As you can see in the query string, no value is passed for the *user* property:
{code:java}
queryString=test&where=TS1&type=page&user=&pageSize=5&highlight=false&sessionUuid=0-0-0-0
{code}
 

*When the space is linked to a JSD project the GET request is:*
{code:java}
Request URL: https://troubleshootingcompany.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/searchv3/1.0/search?queryString=test&where=TS1&type=page&user=anonymous&pageSize=5&highlight=false&sessionUuid=0-0-0-0
{code}
As you can see in the query string, the *user* property is set to anonymous (user=anonymous):
{code:java}
queryString=test&where=TS1&type=page&user=anonymous&pageSize=5&highlight=false&sessionUuid=0-0-0-0{code}
h3.  
h3. Notes

The issue is not reproducible if the site doesn't have Jira Service desk enabled, in that case, the REST API value for the username is empty and the search works as expected
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at the moment
fields.summary: Livesearch Macro is not suggesting results when anonymous access is enabled on a space used for Jira Service Desk KB
Live Search Macro is not suggesting results when anonymous access is enabled

Currently, uninstalling the add-on does not delete the space where the questions are located at, thus, topics and some of the questions are not removed.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Space or Site Backups are failing to generate the zip file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Start a space (or site) backup.

h3. Expected Results
 * The space backup zip file is provided.

h3. Actual Results
 * The backup fails. returning: "Failed to create the zip file"
 !Export-failed-to-create-zip-file.jpg|thumbnail!

The below exception is found in the logs:
{code:java}
2018-09-20 13:32:06	ERROR	com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultSpaceExportService	Could not finalize space export task with Zipper	 	java.lang.RuntimeException: Idle for too long com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultSpaceExportService.handleZipperProgressUpdateEvent(DefaultSpaceExportService.java:230) sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
... 
..{code}
fields.summary: Backups are failing to create zip file

fields.description: Currently, in Confluence Cloud the macro render mode only available for PDF and words when it comes to [embedding a static content macro|http://example.comhttps://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/macro-render-modes/]. It would be useful if the ability for macro render mode to be available in HTML so that user could embed the draw.io diagram on HTML export.
fields.summary: Ability to include Draw.io diagram on HTML export
Confluence Cloud Get user REST API error when requesting existing but not site user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Our Balsamiq app is using a custom macro editor.

When the user close the macro editor, the app invokes the confluence.saveMacro but:

- the macro data is not updated
- the live macro is not updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Balsamiq Wireframes macro
# Create two wireframes
# Publish blog
# Edit
# In the custom macro editor, change to the next wireframe
# Save

Replication video: http://recordit.co/HQjvtP80h1

h3. Expected Results
The same code functions as expected in the "old" Confluence editor.

h3. Actual Results
Macro data are not saved.

h3. Notes
It works on the old Confluence editor.
fields.summary: confluence.saveMacro is not working on the new live macro

fields.description:
With the [Confluence Editing Improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when a user tries to insert a *checkbox*, if no texts are added, the same will only be displayed in the editor and not on the page itself, which means that a text is required for the checkbox content. 

In some cases, users want to have the checkbox separated in a table, for example, and this could be a useful scenario about the same. This is a suggestion to allow the checkbox to be used without any instructional text.
fields.summary: Allow Checkbox to be Used Without a Text

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, the [documentation on Watches|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/watch-pages-spaces-and-blogs-724765353.html], is not quite clear that disabling the notifications from the User's Profile, will not stop notifications about content that the users are watchers.
fields.summary: Explain further how Watches and Email Notifications relates to each other

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Page Tree macro is configured with its root page being a nonexistent page (or even random text), it will cause infinite reloading on the page.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page;
 # Insert a Page Tree macro;
 # Set the macro's root page to be some random text (or a page that doesn't exist) and save;
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The macro shouldn't save and the page should render normally.
h3. Actual Results

The macro saves with the wrong settings and the page will reload forever after published.
h3. Notes

Errors thrown at the console:
 !page_infinite_reloading_errors.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Remove the Page Tree macro or set its root page to be an existing page.
fields.summary: Page Tree macro causing pages to continuously reload

fields.description:
When someone creates a lot of Confluence Pages, changes them very quickly and you are a watcher to changes of this page you get a lot of separate emails in a row about the edits. I would rather like to receive one email with a summary at an interval of 15, 30 or 1 hour interval when changes occur.

As example with 15 minutes interval: The order of events could be:
||Time||Events||Email notification||
|10:02|1 page change|1 email showing 1 change|
|10:03|2 pages change| |
|10:05|1 page change| |
|10:08|4 pages change| |
|10:10|1 page change| |
|10:15|no page change|1 email showing all 8 last changes|

This would help in reducing the amount of emails received, but will still ensure the notifications show that changes occurred and on what pages they occurred.

The one summary per day feature seems to be somewhat similar to it, but its interval is too long.
fields.summary: Add option for setting email notification summary interval

fields.description:
Today all users with the "Service Desk Agent" permission is displayed in the workload report. 

I would like to suggest changing the report to only include users with the "Assignable User" permission instead. 

The reasons behind this are 2: 
 * If I can't be assigned issues, I don't have a workload.
 * As a Jira Admin supporting the JSD team, I want to be able to see everything the team sees to be able to  help them configure their Service Desk. To do this I have to have the Service Desk Agent permission which then means I'll be in the workload report, even though I'm not actually doing any work within the service desk.
fields.summary: Workload report should only display users with the assignable user permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User redirect to an incorrect URL when click on their display name created with *User Profile* macro
 !macro-bug-1.JPG|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *User Profile* macro to your page
# Once published, click on the display name created with *User Profile* macro

h3. Expected Results
* When clicking on user display name, it should redirect to user profile page e.g https://<yoursitename>.atlassian.net/people/<user Atlassian account ID>

h3. Actual Results
* User redirect to URL like this: [https://confluence-prod-us-6-3.prod.atl-paas.net/people/<user Atlassian account ID>?ref=confluence|https://confluence-prod-us-6-3.prod.atl-paas.net/people/<user Atlassian account ID>?ref=confluence]

h3.Workaround
* Hover to the user display name which will pop-up another user profile box, click the display name from there and it should redirect you to user profile page
 !macro-bug.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect redirect for user profile macro

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When editing a Confluence page and bullets are used, the bullets cannot be indented more that one level more than the parent. This causes a limitation on the page format for users.

h2. How to reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# add a bullet and type some text
# add another bullet and type some text
# Click the indent (to the right) button on the editor (the bullet should now be indented one level below the parent).
# Click the indent button again but nothing happens

h3. Expected behavior
The bullet should be indented to as many levels as the user would prefer.

h3. Actual results
Nothing happens when attempting to indent more than one level.

h2. Workaround
Edit or format the content in an editor like Microsoft word and then copy the content to the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Page Bullet indent limited to one level below parent

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space
# Create a new meeting note using the template
# Publish that page

h3. Expected Results
# The [Meeting pages index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/meeting-notes-template-937893665.html#Meetingnotestemplate-Meetingnotesindex] is created, and there is a shortcut to point that page
 !スクリーンショット 2018-09-19 11.12.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No summary pages or shortcuts will be created.
 
h3. Notes
You're using the new blueprint if..
* in the edit page, the URL contains "edit-v2"
* in the edit page. the publish button is at the top-right

h3.Workaround
Atlassian Support can switch the meeting notes blueprint to a legacy one.
Contact support if you wish to do this.
fields.summary: When publishing with the new meeting note blueprint, the meeting note index page is not created

fields.description:
Scenario:

I make major changes and save.

oops forgot to comment.

now I can't add the comment to the correct change.

 

Note:

I did find this page saying it's currently not possible in confluence cloud.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-view-the-edit-history-of-a-comment-in-confluence-831750558.html]
fields.summary: Make comments on page history screen editable.

fields.description:
h3. The issue
When trying to delete topics in Confluence Questions, the same is impossible due to a character validation for topics that have double-quotes on them ("\"").

h3. Error Message:
Error:  Error: "CQL was parsed but searchManager was unable to execute searchContent. CQL: type="ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question"+AND+label="topic1" was parsed to searchContent query due to :com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: Invalid label: "topic1""
fields.summary: Not able to delete topics due to invalid character validation

fields.description: h3. Summary Pasting link text and in some cases pasting extra copied text right after the link will result in this link not being displayed after publishing. h3. Steps to reproduce Initial observations: Published page shows a blank area where the link is, however, storage format shows that the whole link and text has been encapsulated in a that possibly has no display property. {code:html} *​TEXT HIDDEN (Note Welcome* already in DefaultData) {code} * Create a list * Add an external link and fill in the URL and paste in TEXT for the link from the customer's link * Copy & Paste TEXT right after the link in our customer's case. * Publish the page h3. Expected Result Link text and following text should show on the published page h3. Actual Result List item that has the link in question is blank, and the whole element shows that this portion is hidden. h3. Workaround Pasting text as Plain Text in Google Chrome OR typing the text after the link text by hand results in the link being displayed properly.
fields.summary: Pasting a URL and/or Text in the external link makes the URL, text or both disappear

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing confluence from Android mobile, the page only displays the first 100/oldest comments although the page has more than 150 comments.


h3. Steps to replicate:
 # Create a page
 # Add 101 comments to the page
# Install confluence App in Android mobile (Samsung)
# Access the page created in step 1

 h3. Observed Behaviour

Only first 100 comments will be displayed


h3. Expected Result

All 101 comments should be displayed
fields.summary: Only first 100 comment are shown in Android confluence App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Site import with backup generated from Confluence cloud instance failed with the following error

{code}
msg:com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.UserNotFoundException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"404","detail":"A user with <userid> doesn't exists","errorType":"UserDoesNotExist","message":"A user with <userid> doesn't exists","data":"<userid>"}	
{code}

This is caused by the group memberships are declared before the user declaration. Thus, Confluence couldn't find the users and shows the error.
 !screenshot.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform site import with affected backup file
# Site import failed with "A user with <userid> doesn't exists"

h3. Expected Results
# Site import completed successfully

h3. Actual Results
# Failed import with "errorType":"UserDoesNotExist" error

Application logs:
{code}
ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "unq_lwr_username" Detail: Key (lower_username)=(<userid>) already exists.
{code}

h3.Workaround
Relocate all group membership after the user declaration 

Group Memberships
{code}
<object class="HibernateMembership" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2">
</object>
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence Site Import failed due to entities.xml generated contains group memberships that  are declared before the user declaration in the XML file

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new Confluence Editor fails to load macro during content creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new content using the new editor (Blog currently uses it)
# Add a 3rd party macro (Balsamiq Wireframes)
# The app never loads

Replication video: http://recordit.co/lmze9F98tf

h3. Expected Results
No error.

h3. Actual Results
{code}
com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-core-v5.js?externals=__local-default__:formatted:2042 JWT is expired and no content resolver was specified
{code}
 !content_resolver.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Only happens during first content creation. Please see the workaround.

h3. Workaround
# Create a blog/content
# Publish the content
# Hard reload the page (Shift + reload)
# Edit the page and insert the Balsamiq Wireframe macro using the new editor
fields.summary: Content Resolver issue in new Confluence Editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In both the iOS and Android Confluence Mobile Apps, users are unable to insert links to other pages or sites. 

The URLs can be typed or copy/pasted in but are not converted to clickable links and remain plain-text

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option that allows users to add Web Links when using the Mobile Apps or convert URLs to clickable links
 
h3. Workaround 
Edit page from Desktop/Laptop to 'convert' the Plain-Text URLs to clickable links
fields.summary: Include the Ability to Link in or Convert URLs in Mobile Apps

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Deleted object would be re-saved by cascade causing imports to fail

h3. Environment
 
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import Confluence site backup file

h3. Expected Results

Import completes successfully

h3. Actual Results

User Interface shows the following error:

bq. Exception occurred during import: Error importing site

Logs showing:

{code}
2018-09-17 10:12:12	ERROR	com.atlassian.ondemand.confluenceimporter.service.importer.SiteImportTaskRunnerImpl	Error importing site	 	java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException: deleted object would be re-saved by cascade (remove deleted object from associations): [com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space#204496] com.atlassian.progress.amq.ConcurrencyControlTaskProcessor.accept(ConcurrencyControlTaskProcessor.java:19) com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.lambda$doInRequestContext$0(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:49) com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:84) com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:74) com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:48) re-saved by cascade (remove deleted object from associations): [com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space#204496] com.atlassian.ondemand.confluenceimporter.service.importer.SiteImportTaskRunnerImpl.blowAwayExistingData(SiteImportTaskRunnerImpl.java:448) ... 24 lines in common
{code}
 

h3.Workaround

None

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
The preview of spreadsheets in Confluence Cloud is very limited in comparison with the Server version, it would be beneficial for the customers to have a way to display the spreadsheet equally between both applications. The same goes for the export to PDF.
fields.summary: Provide a similar page rendering for Excel files in Cloud as in Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Duplicate Tasks in Reports
h3. Description

Under some circustances, Tasks can be displayed as duplicate in Task Reports.
This is not reproducible 100% of the time, but it has been reported multiple times.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a brand new Confluence page (from a template, such as Meeting Notes), create a task, mentioning a user as its assignee
 # Publish the Page
 # In a different page, create a task report macro, to show tasks assigned to that user and/or go the user's Profile > Tasks

h3. Expected Results

Tasks are displayed as expected
h3. Actual Results

Some tasks are displayed twice.
h3. Workarounds (May not work in all cases)
 # Copy the page with the tasks
 # Publish it
 # Delete the original

OR

Contact [Atlassian Support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/] to manually remove duplicates.
fields.summary: Duplicate Tasks in Reports

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Webhook blueprint_page_created is not being triggered

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Add a webhook event for blueprint_page_created
# Create a blueprint

Best to follow this tutorial: [Multi-page blueprints with Confluence Connect|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/multi-page-blueprints-with-confluence-connect/]

h3. Expected Results
The webhook will be triggered

h3. Actual Results
Webhook is not fired

h3. Notes
Tried using https://connect-inspector.atlassian.io to monitor webhooks and [this blueprint sample|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/confluence-multipage-blueprint-example/src/master/]
fields.summary: Webhook blueprint_page_created is not being triggered

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This issue occurs on random pages.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using one of the templates. I.e.: "How To"page template.
 # Try to access the page afterwards.

h3. Expected Results
The page would render correctly

h3. Actual Results
The page starts to render but suddenly throws the error below:
{noformat}
 "Something's gone wrong.
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support."
{noformat}

h3. Notes

The issue is not always reproducible.

Errors shown in console:
 !console_log_somethings_gone_wrong.png|thumbnail!
{code:java}
app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143 TypeError: Cannot read property 'find' of null
    at d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/fabric.editor.satisfaction.survey.a2a90381858cee156805-v33.js:1
    at t.render (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:50)
    at Ni (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at Ri (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at fa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at pa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at Ga (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at Qa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at za (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at qa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
Mi @ app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143
d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/error-boundary.8a440d9624291a56b599-v33.js:1 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'find' of null
    at d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/fabric.editor.satisfaction.survey.a2a90381858cee156805-v33.js:1
    at t.render (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:50)
    at Ni (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at Ri (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at fa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at pa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at Ga (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at Qa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at za (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
    at qa (app.f7fba82c71a118227559-v33.js:143)
frontend-service-worker-cache.js:152 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to execute 'fetch' on 'ServiceWorkerGlobalScope': 'only-if-cached' can be set only with 'same-origin' mode
    at frontend-service-worker-cache.js:152{code}
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page. 
(i) The workaround may not work for all users.
fields.summary: Pages throwing "something's gone wrong" error when trying to view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When typing a question in the "What do you want to know?" field, it won't suggest an existing questions in some cases. 
An example is when the question has the string "OES".

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new question containing the sting OES, eg.: "In the OES how this is done?"
# Save it and get back to question's main page;
# Start typing "In the OES", and it will search for existing questions;


h3. Expected Results
It should show the existing question as suggestion;

h3. Actual Results
The question is quickly shown but suddenly disappears, as shown below:
|  !in_the_OES.GIF|width=600! |

h3. Notes
* Rebuilding the content index doesn't affect the results.
* It doesn't show any error in the browser's console.
* *Sometimes*, typing a space right after will return the suggestion.

h3.Workaround
No know workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Intermittent behavior when asking a new question - not suggesting existing questions

fields.description:
Currently, if a use hit into an issue while performing a word import due to permission error. There wasn't any error message in the box while importing word document which caused a lot of confusion on a customer and a support perspective whereby this errors wasn't possible to trace from logs since it's not a backend errors. It would be come in handy for the support to work with customer if a precise error message is shown in the UI.

Currently, this is what customer can see from their end:

 !image-2018-09-14-23-43-35-570.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show precise error message during word import

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you include a page that has a Div Macro with Class set to "noprint", exporting the page causes extra lines. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Page 1 (Parent Page)
# Insert *Div Macro* on Page 1 with Class "noprint"
# Create Page 2 (Parent Page)
# Insert *Include Page* macro on Page 2. The page to be included is Page 1
# Create Page 3 (Child Page of Page 2)
# Generate a space PDF export

h3. Expected Results
* Exporting a page to PDF with Include page that has div macro "noprint" should not cause extra lines.

h3. Actual Results
* Exporting a page to PDF with Include page that has div macro "noprint" causes extra lines.
fields.summary: Page Export with Div macro set to no print causes extra lines

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page with page tree macro stay in refresh mode when a page is removed from the space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with page tree macro
# Edit the page tree macro to a page A in Space A
# Move the page A to Space B
# The page keep refreshing every second
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Expected Results

Page stay still and display the content

Actual Results

Page refresh every second

Workaround

# Remove the page tree macro from the Edit mode of the page

https://<your instance.net/wiki/spaces/<space key>/pages/edit/<page ID>
fields.summary: Page contain a page tree macro stay in refresh mode

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Attachments added to blog post fail to open.

h2. How to reproduce
 # Create a new blog post
 # Add an attachment to the blog post
 # Publish the blog post

h3. Expected behaviour
The  attachment should open when clicked

h3. Actual results
An error page is returned
 !Screenshot_254.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Workaround

Currently none.
fields.summary: Attachments in Blog post fail to open
Broken image upon login

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The file previewer won't render TIFF images inside docx documents.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a word docx document with some TIFF image files;
# Attach it to a Confluence Page and publish; 
# Open the document for viewing.

h3. Expected Results
The document should completely render as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The TIFF images inside of the document won't be rendered and big red Xs are shown instead:
 !bigRedXsAsTIFF.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Notes

Note that this can affect on the rendering for TIFF images for Powerpoints as well.

h3.Workaround
Replace the TIFF images with another type as JPG or PNG.
fields.summary: TIFF images inside docx files will not be rendered on the file viewer

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, Confluence has the ability to generated Hyperlinks as well as Images with embedded links. It would be nice to have a way to create buttons on pages as well.

Additionally users should have the ability to create dropdown menus, providing much more flexibility when creating dynamic content.


OR 

Another alternative would be allowing users to use markdown to create their own buttons in Confluence
fields.summary: Allow users to create buttons in Confluence Cloud

fields.description: It would be great if the ability to allow pages to associate with organization role/group is allowed in Confluence so that pages in Confluence wouldn't be obsolete when the author leaves the organization. Hence one a new user has taken the role or being assign to the group, the author will automatically change to the page owner once a new user is take over the current role.
fields.summary: Ability to associate page with organization role/group

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The personas index page is not listing the created personas.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the "persona" template:
 !personas_template.png|thumbnail!
 # It will automatically create the "Personas" index page.

h3. Expected Results

The "Personas" index page should list all existing personas
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't show the existing personas and, when editing the index page, it shows the following error on the Page Properties Report macro:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-business-
blueprints.persona-blueprint.first-column
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Edit the "Personas" index page and remove the `Page Properties Report` macro.
 # Insert a `Content Report Table` and fill in `persona` as the label to filter on and your current space key.
 # Save the page.
fields.summary: The persona index page is not listing the existing personas

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you append a dynamic macro beside a header, the table of contents displays the header as a Stringified version of the dynamic macro.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install a dynamic macro (e.g. [Google Drive & Docs for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216484/google-drive-docs-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview])
# Create page with table of contents first, header with dynamic macro beside it and save (see screenshots for reference on how to do it)
# Notice that the table of contents displays a Stringified version of the dynamic macro

*Expected Result*
As per vendor, would be great if the macro does not display the Stringified version and skip it

h3. Background
A customer of a vendor raised this as they were creating some pages and they wanted to do it in that way
fields.summary: Adding a dynamic macro in the header results in a Stringified version of it in the table of contents macro

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Can not preview an image on blogpost.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a blog
 # Insert a Test image
 # preview the image
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. *Expected Results*

Image was display in preview mode

h3. *Actual Results*

An error message is displayed 
{code}
The file cannot be displayed

Error{code}


h3. *Workaround*
 None
fields.summary: Images can not be preview from blogpost

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Once you upload unsupported files in the Attachments modal in Confluence Cloud, there is no button to close or return. Thus, you are forced to refresh the page in order to try again.

 !modal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: No close button on attachment modal when uploading unsupported files

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user tries to load a page which contains the Attachment macro with tons of attachment files, the page may show one of the errors below:
{code:none}
Something's gone wrong.
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
{code}
{code:none}Error: Rendering this content exceeded the timeout of 30 seconds{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "File list" page (or add "Attachment macro" to an existing page)
 ** !Screenshot 2018-09-12 15.04.28.png|thumbnail!
 # Upload a lot of files to the page
 ** I could reproduce the timeout error with 1200 text files (you can generate dummy files by [^snippet.sh])
 ** !Screenshot 2018-09-12 16.26.25.png|thumbnail!
 ** The upload tends to take time and fail due to "JwtAuthoriser: TokenExpiredError". If you face the error, reload the page and keep uploading the remaining files.
 ** !Screenshot 2018-09-12 16.03.22.png|thumbnail!
 # Load the page and confirm the errors
 ** !Screenshot 2018-09-12 16.25.54.png|thumbnail!
 **  !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The page with the Attachment macro successfully lists up the attachment files.

This *should be paginated* to deal with large number of attachments.
h3. Actual Results

When the error "Something's gone wrong" occurs, the browser console complains the timeout error as below:
{noformat}
GraphQL error: Timeout error querying the remote graphql service
{noformat}
!Screenshot 2018-09-12 16.37.19.png|thumbnail!

The requests to the URLs below take more than 50s to respond:
 * /wiki/rest/graph
 * /cgraphql

!Screenshot 2018-09-12 16.35.26.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
Currently, the only available workaround is to split the attachments into multiple pages, keeping 500 attachments or less on each page.
fields.summary: Attachment macro may cause timeout error when the page has more than 600-ish files

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* OS: Windows
* browser: IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and include Attachments macro
# Publish
# Click "Browse" or drag-and-drop ,and clidk "Upload" to upload the file

h3. Expected Results
The new file is added in the list of the Attachment macro

h3. Actual Results
No files will be added

h3. Note
This is similar to [CONFCLOUD\-62272: Browse for files in the Attachments macro is not uploading files|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-62272] though the differences are:
* drag-and-drop doesn't work
* Happen only in IE
 
h3.Workaround
* Use other browsers, or follow the following steps in IE:
## In the same page, click the three dots on the upper-right corner and click "Attachments"
## Upload the file through that page
fields.summary: Unable to upload files using Attachments macro in IE
Japanese characters in the content causes 400 while calling PUT on /rest/api/content
Freeze to dogfood Comment Refactor and Babel 7 upgrade
Page tree macros causes error “spin is not a function”

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete a space

h3. Expected Results
User is able to move back to active Confluence pages, either by screen transition or from the global sidebar

h3. Actual Results
No menus or icons load on global sidebar and no transitions are made. 
 !スクリーンショット 2018-09-10 12.16.05.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User is unable to navigate after space deletion

fields.description:
I have an issue with PDF-export to Ukrainian language.

I started so search for solution and found that any non-English language will have the same export problems.

Yes, I found this doc in some replies to one of the issues

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-a-pdf-in-another-language-175473.html]

But I have a Mac and I don't know where to take needed fonts.

Anyway it would be much more convenient to select needed font from some predefined list.
fields.summary: As a user of Confluence I would like to have an ability to export to PDF in cyrillic languages without installing any additional fonts
Pages intermittently fail to open the editor
Following a link to an anchor within another page doesn't scroll at all after getting to the other page

fields.description: Grant the Instance Administrators the option to make comments visible to licensed users (set up in groups), individual users, or admins only.
fields.summary: Grant Administrators the ability to set permissions to who will be able to visualize comments in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a page has special character for instance (,) on its title, the links will break as the URL encoded on the page title encoded with %2C whereby the actual link to the page was encoded to %252C
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a comma (,) on its title (let's say "Test,file");
 # Export the space as HTML 
 # Open the Index.html
 # Select on Test,file link to the page and the below message was shown !image-2018-09-07-23-52-52-493.png|width=260,height=181!

h3. Expected Results

The page should be open
h3. Actual Results

Link directed to a file not found error
h3. Workaround 

Open the HTML file with text editor and change the URL to  %252C
fields.summary: Links break on HTML export file if the page title has a special character

fields.description:
I have a page with 34 comments on it (page comments, inline and attachment comments).
I want to know how many comments we have on this page in total. I try this endpoint:
{noformat}
/rest/api/content/{contentId}?expand=descendants.comment{noformat}
Comments are paginated, which is ok, but field _size_ shows how many comments with a limit applied. So, if I have 10 comments, it shows 10, but if I have 50 comments, it shows 25, because the limit is 25.
!image-2018-09-07-16-06-39-975.png!

Bitbucket and Jira APIs always sends a total number of comments in _size_ property.
fields.summary: Incorrect size property when getting all comments for page or blogpost

fields.description: But it's triggered when user resolves attachment comment. Seems like inconsistency.
fields.summary: comment_updated webhook is not triggered when user resolve an inline comment
500 status while hitting /rest/api/content/{contentId}

fields.description: It would be great to have the ability of inserting Tex-like math equations/formulas in Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to insert math formulas/equations in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user creates a new page or edits an existing page using iOS mobile application, user gets *Forbidden* error on publishing page. This only occurs when the user is not granted with space's *Restrictions* and *Admin* permissions.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* iOS mobile application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Revoke user's *Restrictions* and *Admin* permissions for a space.
# Login into an iOS Confluence application.
# Create a new page or edit an existing page.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The page publishes with out any error.

h3. Actual Results
A *Forbidden* error appears and user remains in the edit page screen. However, the changes will be applied.

For example, if you create a new page, when you tap on *Publish*, the _Forbidden_ error appears and you'll see the page editor. And if you tap on *Publish* again it says "A page with this title already exist".

h3.Workaround
Grant the user with *Admin* or *Restrictions* permission.
fields.summary: Forbidden error on publishing page using iOS mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to export Spaces to PDF

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Space Settings of a space 
# Go to *Content Tools* tab -> *Export*
# Mark *PDF* and click Next
# Select either the *Normal Export* or *Custom Export* and click _Export_

h3. Expected Results
The Space will be exported as PDF accordingly

h3. Actual Results
The export fails right after start it at 0% and the following message shows-up:
{quote}
There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.
{quote}
 
h3.Workaround
N/A

h3. Notes

* This is also affecting HTML exports.
fields.summary: Space Exports to PDF/HTML are failing at 0%

fields.description:
By default, Confluence's quick search will only retrieve content based on the title (whether this is for attachments or pages) and if the user would like to search for content *within* the pages, the same must go to the *Full Search* functionality. 

This is a suggestion to allow the administrator to configure the quick search to also retrieve results based on the body of a page, label names or attachments.
fields.summary: Optional Quick Search Results in Confluence

fields.description: It's possible to highlight text in the view page and create a Jira issue inline. It would be nice to be able to do this in the Confluence editor, too.
fields.summary: Add inline Jira issue creation to new editing experience
Page Tree not displayed in Confluence Mobile (Safari)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking on the Confluence Question resulted "Page not found" on mobile.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Question on desktop version of Confluence
# Go back to Confluence mobile view 
# Navigate to the question

h3. Expected Results
Question is shown on the Confluence mobile

h3. Actual Results
"page not found"

h3.Workaround
Switch to desktop view
fields.summary: Click on Confluence Question in Mobile resulted "Page not found"

fields.description: Currently, the pdf page export does not appear in the [Audit Log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/audit-log-802164269.html] and it is expected.  We would like to check if it will be feasible to have implemented a way of logging the pdf export action.
fields.summary: Audit the page export
Search breaks when typing too fast (or pasting text)

fields.description:
When multiple images are added on a blog post, they show different alignment in *preview* mode then they are set in *Edit* mode. Finally, after publishing the blog, images show as aligned.

h3. Expected behavior
Images should show in *preview mode* as aligned in *edit mode*.

h3. Actual behavior
Images show differently in *preview mode* as that of in *edit mode*.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Images alignment is different in preview mode and edit mode
